frontmatter.meta: Thm. 48 of de Jong and Escardó

mainmatter.p: Let \mathcal{U} and \mathcal{V} be two universes. If \mathsf{ZornsLemma} ( \mathcal{U} \sqcup \mathcal{V} ^{+} , \mathcal{V} , \mathcal{V} ) holds then \mathsf{PropositionalResizing} ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} ) holds.

frontmatter.title: Zorn's Lemma in UF
frontmatter.meta: Defn. 47 of de Jong and Escardó

mainmatter.p: Let \mathcal{U}, \mathcal{V}, and \mathcal{W} be universes. Zorn’s Lemma at ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} , \mathcal{W} ) asserts that every pointed ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} , \mathcal{W} )-dcpo has a maximal element.
Let \mathcal{U} and \mathcal{V} be two universes. The propositional ( \mathcal{U} , \mathcal{V} )-resizing axiom says that every proposition P : \mathcal{U} is \mathcal{V}-small.

frontmatter.title: Predicative Aspects of Order Theory in Univalent Foundations
frontmatter.meta: @InProceedings{tdj-mhe-aspects, title = {Predicative Aspects of Order Theory in Univalent Foundations}, author = {de Jong, Tom and Escardó, Martín H.}, date = {2021}, booktitle = {6th International Conference on Formal Structures for Computation and Deduction (FSCD 2021)}, pages = {8:1--8:18}, series = {Leibniz International Proceedings in Informatics (LIPIcs)}, volume = 195, editor = {Kobayashi, Naoki}, publisher = {Schloss Dagstuhl--Leibniz-Zentrum f\"ur Informatik}, doi = {10.4230/LIPIcs.FSCD.2021.8}, }
